page.title: 07HOUSING
page.content: There has been much change in the Shirley area in the past 50 years,because it is on the urban fringe of the Birmingham area.28% of the housing is less than 10 years old;14% between 10 and 25 years; 28% between 25 and 40 years; and 30% over 40 years.The area is affluent, with over a quarter of the housing detached and nearly two thirds semi-detached.Almost all housing was built in the present century,with 8 out of 10 being owner-occupied.The prosperity of the area is illustrated by the fact that over 75% of the households have central heating,TV,automatic washer,freezer,at least 1 car, and over 50% have computers,video recorders and telephones.Several even have their own swimming pools!
